Sentencas: Cubic fluorite structure of ceria doped with 10-mol% calcium, Ce0.9Ca0,O-1(1.9), was prepared using fuel-aided combustion techniques, utilising glycine, urea and citric acid as fuels along with metal nitrates as the oxidiser.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation

Sentencas: The influence of fuel utilised on the combustion process and on physiochemical properties was thoroughly studied.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation

Sentencas: The results of X-ray diffraction showed that all powders calcined at 400 degrees C were of single phase with cubic fluorite structure.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation

Sentencas: Conductivity optimisation was achieved via ceramic sintering at various temperatures within 1000-1200 degrees C.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation

Sentencas: The results showed that Ce0.9Ca0.9O1.9 ceramic prepared using citric acid-aided combustion synthesis had higher ionic conductivity, sigma(800 degrees c) = 0.017 S cm(-1), and lower activation energy, E-a = 0.84 eV, compared to Ce0.9Ca0.1O1.9 ceramics prepared using glycine and urea.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation

Sentencas: The scanning electron microscopy (SEM) results showed that pellets sintered at 1200 degrees C were dense, and the relative densities of these pellets were over 95%, determined using the Archimedes method.
Titulo: Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation
Improved sinterability and conductivity enhancement of 10-mol% calcium-doped ceria using different fuel-aided combustion reactions and its structural characterisation
